snippet.textDisplay: I don't know. Xenoblade was great. the Last Story is great.Earth Seeker is great. Lost Odyssey,Blue Dragon,Renosance of Fate,Nier. Then Look at PSP & DS. Ys series Trails in the Sky,Star Ocean,The World Ends with You,Radiant Historia just to name a  few.

snippet.textDisplay: Everybody saying this has been a bad generation for JRPG's are looking in the wrong spot.  All the good JRPG's moved to handhelds.  As for DS, Radiant Historia is one of the best JRPG's I have ever played, and the genre is the only thing that kept the PSP semi-alive in the last year or so (Sony totally abandoned that thing).
snippet.textOriginal: Everybody saying this has been a bad generation for JRPG's are looking in the wrong spot.  All the good JRPG's moved to handhelds.  As for DS, Radiant Historia is one of the best JRPG's I have ever played, and the genre is the only thing that kept the PSP semi-alive in the last year or so (Sony totally abandoned that thing).

snippet.textDisplay: Seems like most new, possibly different games are being shunned for the franchises that make the most money, hence why E3 was immensely boring, save for a few games, all of which are completely original (The Last of Us, Watch_Dogs, Dishonored). Ever since examples set by EA and Activision regarding the immense cashflow franchises create, games have plummeted in quality.
snippet.textOriginal: Seems like most new, possibly different games are being shunned for the franchises that make the most money, hence why E3 was immensely boring, save for a few games, all of which are completely original (The Last of Us, Watch_Dogs, Dishonored). Ever since examples set by EA and Activision regarding the immense cashflow franchises create, games have plummeted in quality.

snippet.textDisplay: 100% agreed. This generation saw a strange shift. Quality RPGs where thrown by the wayside, but RPG elements were shoehorned into every other game genre you can think of. It was an odd generation.
